action.action-desc: Mr. Zeldin (for himself and Ms. Gabbard) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to eliminate copayments by the Department of Veterans Affairs for medicines relating to preventive health services, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Preventive Health Coverage Fairness Act.

section.header: Improvement to preventive health services furnished by Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Section 1722A(a)(3) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: medication that is or is part of a preventive health service.

subsection.header: Elimination of hospital care and medical services copayments
subsection.text: Section 1710 of such title is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (6); and
by inserting after paragraph (4) the following new paragraph (5):

paragraph.text: A veteran shall not be liable to the United States under this subsection for any amounts for preventive health services.
in subsection (g)(3), by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subsection.text: Section 1701(9) of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (J), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
by redesignating subparagraph (K) as subparagraph (N); and
by inserting after subparagraph (J) the following new subparagraphs:

subparagraph.text: evidence-based items or services that have in effect a rating of A or B in the current recommendations of the United States Preventive Services Task Force;
immunizations that have in effect a recommendation from the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention with respect to the individual involved;

with respect to women, such additional preventive care and screenings not otherwise described in subparagraph (K) as provided for in comprehensive guidelines supported by the Health Resources and Services Administration; and
